channel.title: Writing on Mailund on the Internet
channel.description: Recent content in Writing on Mailund on the Internet

item.title: Books
item.description: I enjoy writing and I’ve written bunch of books by now. Mostly about R programming, but also on a few other topics. When I’m working on a book I haven’t sold yet, I usually put the draft on Leanpub where you can get it for free until it is done.

item.title: Joys of Hashing
item.description: I forgot to post about it when The Joys of Hashing came out, but it is never too late to blow my own horn. It is out and you should get it.

item.title: Erratas
item.description: To my utter shock, it turns out that I am not perfect. There are mistakes in my books! A couple of readers made me aware of a typo in Functional Programming in R.

item.title: Errata: Functional Programming in R
item.description: Chapter 2 The Structure of a Recursive Function, page 32: “Here I am assuming that is an integer…” should be “Here I am assuming that n is an integer…”

item.title: Premarkdown Plugins
item.description: I’m working on a preprocessor for Markdown documents. I write all my books in Markdown, so this is something I have wanted to do for a while, to scratch a few itches I have.

item.title: New Books Page
item.description: I have set up a page for the books I have written. Nothing fancy there, it is just a list together with the cover text, but it does collect all my books on one single page.

item.title: Errata: Functional Data-Structures in R
item.description: One big regret I have about this book is that I didn’t implement the pattern matching code from Domain-Specific Languages in R before this book. Pattern matching makes implementing data structures much easier.
